17 * version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

41#include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CTriangle.hpp"

57
58CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry() : CGeometry() {}
59
60CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry(CConfig* config, unsigned short val_iZone, unsigned short val_nZone)
61 : CGeometry() {
62 edgeColorGroupSize = config->GetEdgeColoringGroupSize();
63
64 string text_line, Marker_Tag;
65 ifstream mesh_file;
66 unsigned short iDim, iMarker, iNodes;
67 unsigned long iPoint, iElem_Bound;
68 nZone = val_nZone;
69 ofstream boundary_file;
70 string Grid_Marker;
71
72 string val_mesh_filename = config->GetMesh_FileName();
73 unsigned short val_format = config->GetMesh_FileFormat();
74
75 /*--- Determine whether or not a FEM discretization is used ---*/
76
77 const bool fem_solver = config->GetFEMSolver();
78
79 /*--- Initialize counters for local/global points & elements ---*/
80
81 if (fem_solver) {
82 switch (val_format) {
83 case SU2:
84 Read_SU2_Format_Parallel_FEM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
85 break;
86
87 case CGNS_GRID:
88 Read_CGNS_Format_Parallel_FEM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
89 break;
90
91 default:
92 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized mesh format specified for the FEM solver!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
93 break;
94 }
95 } else {
96 switch (val_format) {
97 case SU2:
98 case CGNS_GRID:
99 case RECTANGLE:
100 case BOX:
101 Read_Mesh_FVM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
102 break;
103 default:
104 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized mesh format specified!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
105 break;
106 }
107 }
108
109 /*--- After reading the mesh, assert that the dimension is equal to 2 or 3. ---*/
110
111 assert(((nDim == 2) || (nDim == 3)) && "There shall be bugs.");
112
113 /*--- Loop over the points element to re-scale the mesh, and plot it (only SU2_CFD) ---*/
114
115 if (config->GetKind_SU2() == SU2_COMPONENT::SU2_CFD) {
116 /*--- The US system uses feet, but SU2 assumes that the grid is in inches ---*/
117
118 if (config->GetSystemMeasurements() == US) {
119 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
120 for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
121 nodes->SetCoord(iPoint, iDim, nodes->GetCoord(iPoint, iDim) / 12.0);
122 }
123 }
124 }
125 }
126
127 /*--- If SU2_DEF then write a file with the boundary information ---*/
128
129 if ((config->GetKind_SU2() == SU2_COMPONENT::SU2_DEF) && (rank == MASTER_NODE)) {
130 string str = "boundary.dat";
131
132 str = config->GetMultizone_FileName(str, val_iZone, ".dat");
133
134 /*--- Open .su2 grid file ---*/
135
136 boundary_file.open(str.c_str(), ios::out);
137
138 /*--- Loop through and write the boundary info ---*/
139
140 boundary_file << "NMARK= " << nMarker << endl;
141
142 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
143 Grid_Marker = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
144 boundary_file << "MARKER_TAG= " << Grid_Marker << endl;
145 boundary_file << "MARKER_ELEMS= " << nElem_Bound[iMarker] << endl;
146 boundary_file << "SEND_TO= " << config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker) << endl;
147 if (nDim == 2) {
148 for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
149 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() << "\t";
150 for (iNodes = 0; iNodes < bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetnNodes(); iNodes++)
151 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetNode(iNodes) << "\t";
152
153 if (bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() == VERTEX) {
154 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetRotation_Type() << "\t";
155 }
156 boundary_file << iElem_Bound << endl;
157 }
158 }
159
160 if (nDim == 3) {
161 for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
162 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() << "\t";
163 for (iNodes = 0; iNodes < bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetnNodes(); iNodes++)
164 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetNode(iNodes) << "\t";
165
166 if (bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() == VERTEX) {
167 boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetRotation_Type() << "\t";
168 }
169 boundary_file << iElem_Bound << endl;
170 }
171 }
172 }
173
174 boundary_file.close();
175 }
176
177 /*--- If the gradient smoothing solver is active, allocate space for the sensitivity and initialize. ---*/
178 if (config->GetSmoothGradient()) {
179 Sensitivity.resize(nPoint, nDim) = su2double(0.0);
180 }
181}
182
183CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry(CGeometry* geometry, CConfig* config) : CGeometry() {
184 edgeColorGroupSize = config->GetEdgeColoringGroupSize();
185
186 /*--- The new geometry class has the same problem dimension/zone. ---*/
187
188 nDim = geometry->GetnDim();
189 nZone = geometry->GetnZone();
190
191 /*--- Recompute the linear partitioning offsets. ---*/
192
193 PrepareOffsets(geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint());
194
195 /*--- Communicate the coloring data so that each rank has a complete set
196 of colors for all points that reside on it, including repeats. ---*/
197
198 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE)) cout << "Distributing ParMETIS coloring." << endl;
199
200 DistributeColoring(config, geometry);
201
202 /*--- Redistribute the points to all ranks based on the coloring. ---*/
203
204 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE)) cout << "Rebalancing vertices." << endl;
205
206 DistributePoints(config, geometry);
207
208 /*--- Distribute the element information to all ranks based on coloring. ---*/
209
210 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE)) cout << "Rebalancing volume element connectivity." << endl;
211
212 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE);
213 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
214 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, TETRAHEDRON);
215 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, HEXAHEDRON);
216 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, PRISM);
217 DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, PYRAMID);
218
219 /*--- Distribute the marker information to all ranks based on coloring. ---*/
220
221 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE)) cout << "Rebalancing markers and surface elements." << endl;
222
223 /*--- First, perform a linear partitioning of the marker information, as
224 the grid readers currently store all boundary information on the master
225 rank. In the future, this process can be moved directly into the grid
226 reader to avoid reading the markers to the master rank alone at first. ---*/
227
228 DistributeMarkerTags(config, geometry);
229 PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, LINE);
230 PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE);
231 PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
232
233 /*--- Once the markers are distributed according to the linear partitioning
234 of the grid points, we can use similar techniques as above for distributing
235 the surface element connectivity. ---*/
236
237 DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, LINE);
238 DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE);
239 DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
240
241 /*--- Reduce the total number of elements that we have on each rank. ---*/
242
243 nLocal_Elem = (nLocal_Tria + nLocal_Quad + nLocal_Tetr + nLocal_Hexa + nLocal_Pris + nLocal_Pyra);
244 nLocal_Bound_Elem = nLocal_Line + nLocal_BoundTria + nLocal_BoundQuad;
245
246 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&nLocal_Elem, &nGlobal_Elem, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
247 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&nLocal_Bound_Elem, &nGlobal_Bound_Elem, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
248
249 /*--- With the distribution of all points, elements, and markers based
250 on the ParMETIS coloring complete, as a final step, load this data into
251 our geometry class data structures. ---*/
252
253 LoadPoints(config, geometry);
254 LoadVolumeElements(config, geometry);
255 LoadSurfaceElements(config, geometry);
256
257 /*--- If the gradient smoothing solver is active, allocate space for the sensitivity and initialize. ---*/
258 if (config->GetSmoothGradient()) {
259 Sensitivity.resize(nPoint, nDim) = su2double(0.0);
260 }
261
262 /*--- Free memory associated with the partitioning of points and elems. ---*/
263
264 decltype(Neighbors)().swap(Neighbors);
265 decltype(Color_List)().swap(Color_List);
266
267 delete[] Local_Points;
268 delete[] Local_Colors;
269 delete[] Local_Coords;
270
271 delete[] Conn_Line_Linear;
272 delete[] Conn_BoundTria_Linear;
273 delete[] Conn_BoundQuad_Linear;
274
275 delete[] Conn_Line;
276 delete[] Conn_BoundTria;
277 delete[] Conn_BoundQuad;
278 delete[] Conn_Tria;
279 delete[] Conn_Quad;
280 delete[] Conn_Tetr;
281 delete[] Conn_Hexa;
282 delete[] Conn_Pris;
283 delete[] Conn_Pyra;
284
285 delete[] ID_Line;
286 delete[] ID_BoundTria;
287 delete[] ID_BoundQuad;
288 delete[] ID_Line_Linear;
289 delete[] ID_BoundTria_Linear;
290 delete[] ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
291
292 delete[] ID_Tria;
293 delete[] ID_Quad;
294 delete[] ID_Tetr;
295 delete[] ID_Hexa;
296 delete[] ID_Pris;
297 delete[] ID_Pyra;
298
299 delete[] Elem_ID_Line;
300 delete[] Elem_ID_BoundTria;
301 delete[] Elem_ID_BoundQuad;
302 delete[] Elem_ID_Line_Linear;
303 delete[] Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear;
304 delete[] Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
305}
306
307CPhysicalGeometry::~CPhysicalGeometry() {
308 delete[] Local_to_Global_Point;
309
310 /*--- Free up memory from turbomachinery performance computation ---*/
311
312 unsigned short iMarker;
313 if (TangGridVelIn != nullptr) {
314 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
315 if (TangGridVelIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] TangGridVelIn[iMarker];
316 delete[] TangGridVelIn;
317 }
318 if (SpanAreaIn != nullptr) {
319 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
320 if (SpanAreaIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] SpanAreaIn[iMarker];
321 delete[] SpanAreaIn;
322 }
323 if (TurboRadiusIn != nullptr) {
324 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
325 if (TurboRadiusIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] TurboRadiusIn[iMarker];
326 delete[] TurboRadiusIn;
327 }
328 if (TangGridVelOut != nullptr) {
329 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
330 if (TangGridVelOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] TangGridVelOut[iMarker];
331 delete[] TangGridVelOut;
332 }
333 if (SpanAreaOut != nullptr) {
334 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
335 if (SpanAreaOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] SpanAreaOut[iMarker];
336 delete[] SpanAreaOut;
337 }
338 if (TurboRadiusOut != nullptr) {
339 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
340 if (TurboRadiusOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] TurboRadiusOut[iMarker];
341 delete[] TurboRadiusOut;
342 }
343
344 /*--- Free up memory from turbomachinery computations
345 * If there are send/receive boundaries, nMarker isn't the same number
346 * as in the constructor. There must be an explicit check to ensure
347 * that iMarker doesn't point us to memory that was never allocated. ---*/
348
349 unsigned short iSpan, iVertex;
350 if (turbovertex != nullptr) {
351 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
352 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && turbovertex[iMarker] != nullptr) {
353 for (iSpan = 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker]; iSpan++) {
354 if (turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan] != nullptr) {
355 for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertexSpan[iMarker][iSpan]; iVertex++)
356 if (turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan][iVertex] != nullptr) delete turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan][iVertex];
357 delete[] turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan];
358 }
359 }
360 delete[] turbovertex[iMarker];
361 }
362 }
363 delete[] turbovertex;
364 }
365 if (AverageTurboNormal != nullptr) {
366 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
367 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageTurboNormal[iMarker] != nullptr) {
368 for (iSpan = 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker] + 1; iSpan++)
369 delete[] AverageTurboNormal[iMarker][iSpan];
370 delete[] AverageTurboNormal[iMarker];
371 }
372 }
373 delete[] AverageTurboNormal;
374 }
375 if (AverageNormal != nullptr) {
376 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
377 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageNormal[iMarker] != nullptr) {
378 for (iSpan = 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker] + 1; iSpan++) delete[] AverageNormal[iMarker][iSpan];
379 delete[] AverageNormal[iMarker];
380 }
381 }
382 delete[] AverageNormal;
383 }
384 if (AverageGridVel != nullptr) {
385 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
386 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageGridVel[iMarker] != nullptr) {
387 for (iSpan = 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker] + 1; iSpan++) delete[] AverageGridVel[iMarker][iSpan];
388 delete[] AverageGridVel[iMarker];
389 }
390 }
391 delete[] AverageGridVel;
392 }
393
394 if (AverageTangGridVel != nullptr) {
395 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
396 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageTangGridVel[iMarker] != nullptr)
397 delete[] AverageTangGridVel[iMarker];
398 delete[] AverageTangGridVel;
399 }
400 if (SpanArea != nullptr) {
401 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
402 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && SpanArea[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] SpanArea[iMarker];
403 delete[] SpanArea;
404 }
405 if (TurboRadius != nullptr) {
406 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
407 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && TurboRadius[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] TurboRadius[iMarker];
408 delete[] TurboRadius;
409 }
410 if (MaxAngularCoord != nullptr) {
411 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
412 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MaxAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] MaxAngularCoord[iMarker];
413 delete[] MaxAngularCoord;
414 }
415 if (MinAngularCoord != nullptr) {
416 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
417 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MinAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] MinAngularCoord[iMarker];
418 delete[] MinAngularCoord;
419 }
420 if (MinRelAngularCoord != nullptr) {
421 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
422 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MinRelAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr)
423 delete[] MinRelAngularCoord[iMarker];
424 delete[] MinRelAngularCoord;
425 }
426
427 delete[] nSpanWiseSections;
428 delete[] nSpanSectionsByMarker;
429 if (SpanWiseValue != nullptr) {
430 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < 2; iMarker++)
431 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && SpanWiseValue[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] SpanWiseValue[iMarker];
432 delete[] SpanWiseValue;
433 }
434 if (nVertexSpan != nullptr) {
435 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
436 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && nVertexSpan[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] nVertexSpan[iMarker];
437 delete[] nVertexSpan;
438 }
439 if (nTotVertexSpan != nullptr) {
440 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
441 if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && nTotVertexSpan[iMarker] != nullptr) delete[] nTotVertexSpan[iMarker];
442 delete[] nTotVertexSpan;
443 }
444}
445
446void CPhysicalGeometry::SetGlobal_to_Local_Point() {
447 Global_to_Local_Point.clear();
448 for (unsigned long iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPointDomain; iPoint++) {
449 Global_to_Local_Point[nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint)] = iPoint;
450 }
451}
452
453void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeColoring(const CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry) {
454 /*--- To start, each linear partition carries the color only for the
455 owned nodes (nPoint), but we have repeated elems on each linear partition.
456 We need to complete the coloring information such that the repeated
457 points on each rank also have their color values. ---*/
458
459 unsigned short iNode, jNode;
460 unsigned long iPoint, iNeighbor, jPoint, iElem, iProcessor;
461
462 unordered_set<unsigned long> Point_Map;
463
464 SU2_MPI::Request *colorSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
465 SU2_MPI::Request *colorRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
466 int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
467
468 /*--- Get a linear partitioner to track the partition counts. ---*/
469
470 CLinearPartitioner pointPartitioner(geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint(), 0);
471
472 /*--- First, create a complete map of the points on this rank (excluding
473 repeats) and their neighbors so that we can efficiently loop through the
474 points and decide how to distribute the colors. ---*/
475
476 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
477 for (iNode = 0; iNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
478 iPoint = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
479 Point_Map.insert(iPoint);
480 }
481 }
482
483 /*--- Error check to ensure that the number of points found for this
484 rank matches the number in the mesh file (in serial). ---*/
485
486 if ((size == SINGLE_NODE) && (Point_Map.size() < geometry->GetnPoint())) {
487 SU2_MPI::Error(string("Mismatch between NPOIN and number of points") + string(" listed in mesh file.\n") +
488 string("Please check the mesh file for correctness.\n"),
489 CURRENT_FUNCTION);
490 }
491
492 /*--- Create a global to local mapping that includes the unowned points. ---*/
493
494 unordered_map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Global2Local;
495 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
496 Global2Local[geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint)] = iPoint;
497 }
498
499 /*--- Find extra points that carry an index higher than nPoint. ---*/
500
501 jPoint = geometry->GetnPoint();
502 for (auto iPoint : Point_Map) {
503 if ((iPoint < pointPartitioner.GetFirstIndexOnRank(rank)) ||
504 (iPoint >= pointPartitioner.GetLastIndexOnRank(rank))) {
505 Global2Local[iPoint] = jPoint;
506 jPoint++;
507 }
508 }
509
510 /*--- Now create the neighbor list for each owned node (self-inclusive). ---*/
511
512 Neighbors.clear();
513 Neighbors.resize(Point_Map.size());
514 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
515 for (iNode = 0; iNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
516 iPoint = Global2Local[geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode)];
517 for (jNode = 0; jNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); jNode++) {
518 jPoint = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
519 Neighbors[iPoint].push_back(jPoint);
520 }
521 }
522 }
523
524 /*--- Post-process the neighbor lists. ---*/
525
526 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < Point_Map.size(); iPoint++) {
527 sort(Neighbors[iPoint].begin(), Neighbors[iPoint].end());
528 auto it = unique(Neighbors[iPoint].begin(), Neighbors[iPoint].end());
529 Neighbors[iPoint].resize(it - Neighbors[iPoint].begin());
530 }
531
532 /*--- Prepare structures for communication. ---*/
533
534 int* nPoint_Send = new int[size + 1];
535 nPoint_Send[0] = 0;
536 int* nPoint_Recv = new int[size + 1];
537 nPoint_Recv[0] = 0;
538 int* nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
539
540 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
541 nPoint_Send[iProc] = 0;
542 nPoint_Recv[iProc] = 0;
543 nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
544 }
545 nPoint_Send[size] = 0;
546 nPoint_Recv[size] = 0;
547
548 /*--- Loop over the owned points and check all the neighbors for unowned
549 points. The colors of all owned points will be communicated to any ranks
550 that will require them, which is due to the repeated points/elements
551 that were needed to perform the coloring. ---*/
552
553 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
554 for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
555 /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
556
557 jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
558
559 /*--- Search for the processor that owns this neighbor. ---*/
560
561 iProcessor = pointPartitioner.GetRankContainingIndex(jPoint);
562
563 /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
564 number of points that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
565
566 if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
567 nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
568 nPoint_Send[iProcessor + 1]++;
569 }
570 }
571 }
572
573 /*--- Communicate the number of nodes to be sent/recv'd amongst
574 all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
575 many points it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
576
577 SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT, &(nPoint_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
578
579 /*--- Prepare to send colors. First check how many
580 messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
581 the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
582 communications simpler. ---*/
583
584 int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
585 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
586
587 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
588 if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Send[iProc + 1] > 0)) nSends++;
589 if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Recv[iProc + 1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
590
591 nPoint_Send[iProc + 1] += nPoint_Send[iProc];
592 nPoint_Recv[iProc + 1] += nPoint_Recv[iProc];
593 }
594
595 /*--- Allocate arrays for sending the global ID. ---*/
596
597 auto* idSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
598 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
599
600 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the colors that we are sending. ---*/
601
602 auto* colorSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
603 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) colorSend[iSend] = 0;
604
605 /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
606 positions as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
607
608 auto* index = new unsigned long[size];
609 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = nPoint_Send[iProc];
610
611 /*--- Now load up our buffers with the Global IDs and colors. ---*/
612
613 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
614 for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
615 /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
616
617 jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
618
619 /*--- Search for the processor that owns this neighbor ---*/
620
621 iProcessor = pointPartitioner.GetRankContainingIndex(jPoint);
622
623 /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
624 counters and load up the global ID and color. ---*/
625
626 if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
627 nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
628 unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
629
630 /*--- Load the data values. ---*/
631
632 idSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint);
633 colorSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetColor(iPoint);
634
635 /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
636
637 index[iProcessor]++;
638 }
639 }
640 }
641
642 /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
643
644 delete[] index;
645
646 /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
647 values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
648 we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
649 directly copy our own data later. ---*/
650
651 auto* colorRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
652 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) colorRecv[iRecv] = 0;
653
654 auto* idRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
655 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
656
657 /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
658
659 if (nSends > 0) {
660 colorSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
661 idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
662 }
663 if (nRecvs > 0) {
664 colorRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
665 idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
666 }
667
668 /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
669
670 InitiateCommsAll(colorSend, nPoint_Send, colorSendReq, colorRecv, nPoint_Recv, colorRecvReq, 1,
671 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
672
673 InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nPoint_Send, idSendReq, idRecv, nPoint_Recv, idRecvReq, 1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
674
675 /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
676
677 iRecv = nPoint_Recv[rank];
678 myStart = nPoint_Send[rank];
679 myFinal = nPoint_Send[rank + 1];
680 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
681 colorRecv[iRecv] = colorSend[iSend];
682 idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
683 iRecv++;
684 }
685
686 /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
687
688 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, colorSendReq, nRecvs, colorRecvReq);
689 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
690
691 /*--- Store the complete color map for this rank in class data. Now,
692 each rank has a color value for all owned nodes as well as any repeated
693 grid points on the rank. Note that there may be repeats that are
694 communicated in the routine above, but since we are storing in a map,
695 it will simply overwrite the same entries. ---*/
696
697 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
698 Color_List[idRecv[iRecv]] = colorRecv[iRecv];
699 }
700
701 /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
702
703 delete[] colorSendReq;
704 delete[] idSendReq;
705
706 delete[] colorRecvReq;
707 delete[] idRecvReq;
708
709 delete[] colorSend;
710 delete[] colorRecv;
711 delete[] idSend;
712 delete[] idRecv;
713 delete[] nPoint_Recv;
714 delete[] nPoint_Send;
715 delete[] nPoint_Flag;
716}
717
718void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeVolumeConnectivity(const CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry,
719 unsigned short Elem_Type) {
720 unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
721
722 unsigned long iProcessor;
723 unsigned long iElem, iNode, jNode, nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index;
724 unsigned long* Conn_Elem = nullptr;
725 unsigned long* ID_Elems = nullptr;
726
727 SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
728 SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
729 int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
730
731 /*--- Store the number of nodes per this element type. ---*/
732
733 switch (Elem_Type) {
734 case TRIANGLE:
735 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
736 break;
737 case QUADRILATERAL:
738 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
739 break;
740 case TETRAHEDRON:
741 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TETRAHEDRON;
742 break;
743 case HEXAHEDRON:
744 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_HEXAHEDRON;
745 break;
746 case PRISM:
747 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_PRISM;
748 break;
749 case PYRAMID:
750 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_PYRAMID;
751 break;
752 default:
753 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
754 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
755 break;
756 }
757
758 /*--- Prepare a mapping for local to global element index. ---*/
759
760 vector<unsigned long> Local2GlobalElem(geometry->Global_to_Local_Elem.size());
761
762 for (auto p : geometry->Global_to_Local_Elem) {
763 Local2GlobalElem[p.second] = p.first;
764 }
765
766 /*--- We start with the connectivity distributed across all procs in a
767 linear partitioning. We need to loop through our local partition
768 and decide how many elements we must send to each other rank in order to
769 have all elements distributed according to the ParMETIS coloring. ---*/
770
771 int* nElem_Send = new int[size + 1];
772 nElem_Send[0] = 0;
773 int* nElem_Recv = new int[size + 1];
774 nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
775 int* nElem_Flag = new int[size];
776
777 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
778 nElem_Send[iProc] = 0;
779 nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0;
780 nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
781 }
782 nElem_Send[size] = 0;
783 nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
784
785 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
786 if (geometry->elem[iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
787 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
788 /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
789
790 Global_Index = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
791
792 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
793
794 iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
795
796 /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
797 number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
798
799 if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
800 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
801 nElem_Send[iProcessor + 1]++;
802 }
803 }
804 }
805 }
806
807 /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
808 all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
809 many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
810
811 SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT, &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
812
813 /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
814 messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
815 the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
816 communications simpler. ---*/
817
818 int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
819 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
820
821 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
822 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc + 1] > 0)) nSends++;
823 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
824
825 nElem_Send[iProc + 1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
826 nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
827 }
828
829 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity and element IDs
830 that we are sending. ---*/
831
832 unsigned long* connSend = nullptr;
833 connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]];
834 for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) connSend[iSend] = 0;
835
836 /*--- Allocate arrays for storing element global index. ---*/
837
838 auto* idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
839 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
840
841 /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
842 position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
843
844 auto* index = new unsigned long[size];
845 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[iProc];
846
847 auto* idIndex = new unsigned long[size];
848 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) idIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
849
850 /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
851 additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
852
853 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
854 if (geometry->elem[iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
855 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
856 /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
857
858 Global_Index = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
859
860 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
861
862 iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
863
864 /*--- Load connectivity and IDs into the buffer for sending ---*/
865
866 if (nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem) {
867 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
868 unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
869 unsigned long mm = idIndex[iProcessor];
870
871 /*--- Load the connectivity values. Note that elements are already
872 stored directly based on their global index for the nodes.---*/
873
874 for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
875 connSend[nn] = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
876 nn++;
877 }
878
879 /*--- Global ID for this element. ---*/
880
881 idSend[mm] = Local2GlobalElem[iElem];
882
883 /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
884
885 index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
886 idIndex[iProcessor]++;
887 }
888 }
889 }
890 }
891
892 /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
893
894 delete[] index;
895 delete[] idIndex;
896
897 /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the
898 values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
899 we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
900 directly copy our own data later. ---*/
901
902 unsigned long* connRecv = nullptr;
903 connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
904 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
905
906 auto* idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
907 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
908
909 /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
910
911 if (nSends > 0) {
912 connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
913 idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
914 }
915 if (nRecvs > 0) {
916 connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
917 idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
918 }
919
920 /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
921
922 InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq, connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq, NODES_PER_ELEMENT,
923 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
924
925 InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq, idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq, 1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
926
927 /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
928
929 iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[rank];
930 myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank];
931 myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank + 1];
932 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
933 connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
934 iRecv++;
935 }
936
937 iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
938 myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
939 myFinal = nElem_Send[rank + 1];
940 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
941 idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
942 iRecv++;
943 }
944
945 /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
946
947 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
948 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
949
950 /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper structure
951 It will be loaded into the geometry objects in a later step. ---*/
952
953 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
954 Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
955 int count = 0;
956 nElem_Total = 0;
957 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
958 nElem_Total++;
959 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
960 Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
961 count++;
962 }
963 }
964 }
965
966 /*--- Store the global element IDs too. ---*/
967
968 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
969 ID_Elems = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
970 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
971 ID_Elems[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
972 }
973 }
974
975 /*--- Store the particular element count, IDs, & conn. in the class data,
976 and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
977
978 switch (Elem_Type) {
979 case TRIANGLE:
980 nLocal_Tria = nElem_Total;
981 if (nLocal_Tria > 0) {
982 Conn_Tria = Conn_Elem;
983 ID_Tria = ID_Elems;
984 }
985 break;
986 case QUADRILATERAL:
987 nLocal_Quad = nElem_Total;
988 if (nLocal_Quad > 0) {
989 Conn_Quad = Conn_Elem;
990 ID_Quad = ID_Elems;
991 }
992 break;
993 case TETRAHEDRON:
994 nLocal_Tetr = nElem_Total;
995 if (nLocal_Tetr > 0) {
996 Conn_Tetr = Conn_Elem;
997 ID_Tetr = ID_Elems;
998 }
999 break;
1000 case HEXAHEDRON:
1001 nLocal_Hexa = nElem_Total;
1002 if (nLocal_Hexa > 0) {
1003 Conn_Hexa = Conn_Elem;
1004 ID_Hexa = ID_Elems;
1005 }
1006 break;
1007 case PRISM:
1008 nLocal_Pris = nElem_Total;
1009 if (nLocal_Pris > 0) {
1010 Conn_Pris = Conn_Elem;
1011 ID_Pris = ID_Elems;
1012 }
1013 break;
1014 case PYRAMID:
1015 nLocal_Pyra = nElem_Total;
1016 if (nLocal_Pyra > 0) {
1017 Conn_Pyra = Conn_Elem;
1018 ID_Pyra = ID_Elems;
1019 }
1020 break;
1021 default:
1022 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1023 break;
1024 }
1025
1026 /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1027
1028 delete[] connSendReq;
1029 delete[] idSendReq;
1030
1031 delete[] connRecvReq;
1032 delete[] idRecvReq;
1033
1034 delete[] connSend;
1035 delete[] connRecv;
1036 delete[] idSend;
1037 delete[] idRecv;
1038 delete[] nElem_Recv;
1039 delete[] nElem_Send;
1040 delete[] nElem_Flag;
1041}
1042
1043void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributePoints(const CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry) {
1044 /*--- We now know all of the coloring for our local points and neighbors.
1045 From this, we can communicate the owned nodes in our linear partitioning
1046 to all other ranks, including coordinates and coloring info, so that the
1047 receivers will be able to sort the data. ---*/
1048
1049 unsigned short iDim;
1050 unsigned long iPoint, iNeighbor, jPoint, iProcessor;
1051
1052 SU2_MPI::Request *colorSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr, *coordSendReq = nullptr;
1053 SU2_MPI::Request *colorRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr, *coordRecvReq = nullptr;
1054 int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1055
1056 /*--- Prepare structures for communication. ---*/
1057
1058 int* nPoint_Send = new int[size + 1];
1059 nPoint_Send[0] = 0;
1060 int* nPoint_Recv = new int[size + 1];
1061 nPoint_Recv[0] = 0;
1062 int* nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
1063
1064 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1065 nPoint_Send[iProc] = 0;
1066 nPoint_Recv[iProc] = 0;
1067 nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1068 }
1069 nPoint_Send[size] = 0;
1070 nPoint_Recv[size] = 0;
1071
1072 /*--- Loop over the owned points and check all the neighbors for unowned
1073 points. The colors of all owned points will be communicated to any ranks
1074 that will require them, which is due to the repeated points/elements
1075 that were needed to perform the coloring. ---*/
1076
1077 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
1078 for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
1079 /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
1080
1081 jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
1082
1083 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1084
1085 iProcessor = Color_List[jPoint];
1086
1087 /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
1088 number of points that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1089
1090 if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
1091 nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
1092 nPoint_Send[iProcessor + 1]++;
1093 }
1094 }
1095 }
1096
1097 /*--- Communicate the number of nodes to be sent/recv'd amongst
1098 all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1099 many points it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1100
1101 SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT, &(nPoint_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1102
1103 /*--- Prepare to send colors, ids, and coords. First check how many
1104 messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1105 the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1106 communications simpler. ---*/
1107
1108 int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1109 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1110
1111 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1112 if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Send[iProc + 1] > 0)) nSends++;
1113 if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Recv[iProc + 1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1114
1115 nPoint_Send[iProc + 1] += nPoint_Send[iProc];
1116 nPoint_Recv[iProc + 1] += nPoint_Recv[iProc];
1117 }
1118
1119 /*--- Allocate arrays for sending the global ID. ---*/
1120
1121 auto* idSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
1122 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
1123
1124 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the colors that we are sending. ---*/
1125
1126 auto* colorSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
1127 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) colorSend[iSend] = 0;
1128
1129 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the coordinates that we are sending. ---*/
1130
1131 su2double* coordSend = nullptr;
1132 coordSend = new su2double[nDim * nPoint_Send[size]];
1133 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nDim * nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) coordSend[iSend] = 0;
1134
1135 /*--- Create index variables to keep track of our index
1136 positions as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1137
1138 auto* index = new unsigned long[size];
1139 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = nPoint_Send[iProc];
1140
1141 auto* coordIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1142 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) coordIndex[iProc] = nDim * nPoint_Send[iProc];
1143
1144 /*--- Now load up our buffers with the colors, ids, and coords. ---*/
1145
1146 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
1147 for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
1148 /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
1149
1150 jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
1151
1152 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1153
1154 iProcessor = Color_List[jPoint];
1155
1156 /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
1157 counters and load up the colors, ids, and coords. ---*/
1158
1159 if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
1160 nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
1161 unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1162
1163 /*--- Load the global ID, color, and coordinate values. ---*/
1164
1165 idSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint);
1166 colorSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetColor(iPoint);
1167
1168 nn = coordIndex[iProcessor];
1169 for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
1170 coordSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetCoord(iPoint, iDim);
1171 nn++;
1172 }
1173
1174 /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1175
1176 coordIndex[iProcessor] += nDim;
1177 index[iProcessor]++;
1178 }
1179 }
1180 }
1181
1182 /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1183
1184 delete[] index;
1185 delete[] coordIndex;
1186
1187 /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the
1188 values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1189 we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1190 directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1191
1192 auto* colorRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1193 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) colorRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1194
1195 auto* idRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1196 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1197
1198 su2double* coordRecv = nullptr;
1199 coordRecv = new su2double[nDim * nPoint_Recv[size]];
1200 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nDim * nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) coordRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1201
1202 /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1203
1204 if (nSends > 0) {
1205 colorSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1206 idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1207 coordSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1208 }
1209 if (nRecvs > 0) {
1210 colorRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1211 idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1212 coordRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1213 }
1214
1215 /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1216
1217 InitiateCommsAll(colorSend, nPoint_Send, colorSendReq, colorRecv, nPoint_Recv, colorRecvReq, 1,
1218 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1219
1220 InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nPoint_Send, idSendReq, idRecv, nPoint_Recv, idRecvReq, 1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1221
1222 InitiateCommsAll(coordSend, nPoint_Send, coordSendReq, coordRecv, nPoint_Recv, coordRecvReq, nDim, COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE);
1223
1224 /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1225
1226 iRecv = nPoint_Recv[rank];
1227 myStart = nPoint_Send[rank];
1228 myFinal = nPoint_Send[rank + 1];
1229 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1230 colorRecv[iRecv] = colorSend[iSend];
1231 idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1232 iRecv++;
1233 }
1234
1235 iRecv = nDim * nPoint_Recv[rank];
1236 myStart = nDim * nPoint_Send[rank];
1237 myFinal = nDim * nPoint_Send[rank + 1];
1238 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1239 coordRecv[iRecv] = coordSend[iSend];
1240 iRecv++;
1241 }
1242
1243 /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1244
1245 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, colorSendReq, nRecvs, colorRecvReq);
1246 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1247 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, coordSendReq, nRecvs, coordRecvReq);
1248
1249 /*--- Store the total number of local points my rank has for
1250 the current section after completing the communications. ---*/
1251
1252 nLocal_Point = nPoint_Recv[size];
1253
1254 /*--- Store the proper local IDs, colors, and coordinates. We will load
1255 all of this information into our geometry classes in a later step. ---*/
1256
1257 Local_Points = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1258 Local_Colors = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1259 Local_Coords = new su2double[nDim * nPoint_Recv[size]];
1260
1261 nLocal_PointDomain = 0;
1262 nLocal_PointGhost = 0;
1263 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1264 Local_Points[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1265 Local_Colors[iRecv] = colorRecv[iRecv];
1266 for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) Local_Coords[iRecv * nDim + iDim] = coordRecv[iRecv * nDim + iDim];
1267 if (Local_Colors[iRecv] == (unsigned long)rank)
1268 nLocal_PointDomain++;
1269 else
1270 nLocal_PointGhost++;
1271 }
1272
1273 /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1274
1275 delete[] colorSendReq;
1276 delete[] idSendReq;
1277 delete[] coordSendReq;
1278
1279 delete[] colorRecvReq;
1280 delete[] idRecvReq;
1281 delete[] coordRecvReq;
1282
1283 delete[] colorSend;
1284 delete[] colorRecv;
1285 delete[] idSend;
1286 delete[] idRecv;
1287 delete[] coordSend;
1288 delete[] coordRecv;
1289 delete[] nPoint_Recv;
1290 delete[] nPoint_Send;
1291 delete[] nPoint_Flag;
1292}
1293
1294void CPhysicalGeometry::PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry, unsigned short Elem_Type) {
1295 /*--- We begin with all marker information residing on the master rank,
1296 as the master currently stores all marker info when reading the grid.
1297 We first check and communicate basic information that each rank will
1298 need to hold its portion of the linearly partitioned markers. In a
1299 later step, we will distribute the markers according to the ParMETIS
1300 coloring. This intermediate step is necessary since we already have the
1301 correct coloring distributed by the linear partitions, which we would
1302 like to reuse when partitioning the markers. Plus, the markers should
1303 truly be linearly partitioned upon reading the mesh, which we will
1304 change eventually. ---*/
1305
1306 unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
1307
1308 unsigned long iMarker, iProcessor, iElem, iNode, jNode;
1309 unsigned long nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index, Global_Elem_Index;
1310
1311 unsigned long* Conn_Elem = nullptr;
1312 unsigned long* Linear_Markers = nullptr;
1313 unsigned long* ID_SurfElem = nullptr;
1314
1315 SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr, *markerSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
1316 SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr, *markerRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
1317 int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1318
1319 /*--- Store the local number of this element type and the number of nodes
1320 per this element type. In serial, this will be the total number of this
1321 element type in the entire mesh. In parallel, it is the number on only
1322 the current partition. ---*/
1323
1324 switch (Elem_Type) {
1325 case LINE:
1326 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_LINE;
1327 break;
1328 case TRIANGLE:
1329 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
1330 break;
1331 case QUADRILATERAL:
1332 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
1333 break;
1334 default:
1335 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1336 break;
1337 }
1338
1339 int* nElem_Send = new int[size + 1];
1340 nElem_Send[0] = 0;
1341 int* nElem_Recv = new int[size + 1];
1342 nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
1343 int* nElem_Flag = new int[size];
1344
1345 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1346 nElem_Send[iProc] = 0;
1347 nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0;
1348 nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1349 }
1350 nElem_Send[size] = 0;
1351 nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
1352
1353 /*--- We know that the master owns all of the info and will be the only
1354 rank sending anything, although all ranks might receive something. ---*/
1355
1356 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1357 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < geometry->GetnMarker(); iMarker++) {
1358 /*--- Reset the flag in between markers, just to ensure that we
1359 don't miss some elements on different markers with the same local
1360 index. ---*/
1361
1362 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1363
1364 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); iElem++) {
1365 if (geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
1366 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1367 /*--- Get the index of the current point (stored as global). ---*/
1368
1369 Global_Index = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
1370
1371 /*--- Search for the processor that owns this point ---*/
1372
1373 iProcessor = GetLinearPartition(Global_Index);
1374
1375 /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
1376 number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1377
1378 if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1379 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1380 nElem_Send[iProcessor + 1]++;
1381 }
1382 }
1383 }
1384 }
1385 }
1386 }
1387
1388 /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
1389 all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1390 many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1391
1392 SU2_MPI::Scatter(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT, &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1393
1394 /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
1395 messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1396 the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1397 communications simpler. ---*/
1398
1399 int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1400 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1401
1402 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1403 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc + 1] > 0)) nSends++;
1404 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1405
1406 nElem_Send[iProc + 1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
1407 nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
1408 }
1409
1410 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity that we are sending. ---*/
1411
1412 unsigned long* connSend = nullptr;
1413 unsigned long* markerSend = nullptr;
1414 unsigned long* idSend = nullptr;
1415
1416 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1417 connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]];
1418 for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) connSend[iSend] = 0;
1419
1420 markerSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1421 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) markerSend[iSend] = 0;
1422
1423 idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1424 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
1425
1426 /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
1427 position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1428
1429 auto* index = new unsigned long[size];
1430 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[iProc];
1431
1432 auto* markerIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1433 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) markerIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
1434
1435 /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
1436 additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
1437
1438 Global_Elem_Index = 0;
1439 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < geometry->GetnMarker(); iMarker++) {
1440 /*--- Reset the flag in between markers, just to ensure that we
1441 don't miss some elements on different markers with the same local
1442 index. ---*/
1443
1444 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1445
1446 for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); iElem++) {
1447 if (geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
1448 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1449 /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1450
1451 Global_Index = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
1452
1453 /*--- Search for the processor that owns this point ---*/
1454
1455 iProcessor = GetLinearPartition(Global_Index);
1456
1457 /*--- Load connectivity into the buffer for sending ---*/
1458
1459 if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1460 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1461 unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1462 unsigned long mm = markerIndex[iProcessor];
1463
1464 /*--- Load the connectivity values. ---*/
1465
1466 for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
1467 connSend[nn] = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
1468 nn++;
1469 }
1470
1471 /*--- Store the marker index and surface elem global ID ---*/
1472
1473 markerSend[mm] = iMarker;
1474 idSend[mm] = Global_Elem_Index;
1475
1476 /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1477
1478 index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
1479 markerIndex[iProcessor]++;
1480 }
1481 }
1482 }
1483
1484 Global_Elem_Index++;
1485 }
1486 }
1487
1488 /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1489
1490 delete[] index;
1491 delete[] markerIndex;
1492 }
1493
1494 /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
1495 values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1496 we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1497 directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1498
1499 unsigned long* connRecv = nullptr;
1500 connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
1501 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1502
1503 auto* markerRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1504 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) markerRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1505
1506 auto* idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1507 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1508
1509 /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1510
1511 if (nSends > 0) {
1512 connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1513 markerSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1514 idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1515 }
1516 if (nRecvs > 0) {
1517 connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1518 markerRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1519 idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1520 }
1521
1522 /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1523
1524 InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq, connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq, NODES_PER_ELEMENT,
1525 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1526
1527 InitiateCommsAll(markerSend, nElem_Send, markerSendReq, markerRecv, nElem_Recv, markerRecvReq, 1,
1528 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1529
1530 InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq, idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq, 1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1531
1532 /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1533
1534 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1535 iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[rank];
1536 myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank];
1537 myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank + 1];
1538 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1539 connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
1540 iRecv++;
1541 }
1542
1543 iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
1544 myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
1545 myFinal = nElem_Send[rank + 1];
1546 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1547 markerRecv[iRecv] = markerSend[iSend];
1548 idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1549 iRecv++;
1550 }
1551 }
1552
1553 /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1554
1555 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
1556 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, markerSendReq, nRecvs, markerRecvReq);
1557 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1558
1559 /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper data
1560 structure before post-processing below. First, allocate
1561 appropriate amount of memory for this section. ---*/
1562
1563 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1564 Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
1565 int count = 0;
1566 nElem_Total = 0;
1567 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1568 nElem_Total++;
1569 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1570 Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
1571 count++;
1572 }
1573 }
1574 }
1575
1576 /*--- Store the global marker ID for each element. ---*/
1577
1578 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1579 Linear_Markers = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1580 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1581 Linear_Markers[iRecv] = markerRecv[iRecv];
1582 }
1583 }
1584
1585 /*--- Store the global surface elem ID for each element. ---*/
1586
1587 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1588 ID_SurfElem = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1589 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1590 ID_SurfElem[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1591 }
1592 }
1593
1594 /*--- Store the particular global element count in the class data,
1595 and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
1596
1597 switch (Elem_Type) {
1598 case LINE:
1599 nLinear_Line = nElem_Total;
1600 if (nLinear_Line > 0) {
1601 Conn_Line_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1602 ID_Line_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1603 Elem_ID_Line_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1604 }
1605 break;
1606 case TRIANGLE:
1607 nLinear_BoundTria = nElem_Total;
1608 if (nLinear_BoundTria > 0) {
1609 Conn_BoundTria_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1610 ID_BoundTria_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1611 Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1612 }
1613 break;
1614 case QUADRILATERAL:
1615 nLinear_BoundQuad = nElem_Total;
1616 if (nLinear_BoundQuad > 0) {
1617 Conn_BoundQuad_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1618 ID_BoundQuad_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1619 Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1620 }
1621 break;
1622 default:
1623 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1624 break;
1625 }
1626
1627 /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1628
1629 delete[] connSendReq;
1630 delete[] markerSendReq;
1631 delete[] idSendReq;
1632
1633 delete[] connRecvReq;
1634 delete[] markerRecvReq;
1635 delete[] idRecvReq;
1636
1637 delete[] connSend;
1638 delete[] markerSend;
1639 delete[] idSend;
1640
1641 delete[] connRecv;
1642 delete[] markerRecv;
1643 delete[] idRecv;
1644
1645 delete[] nElem_Recv;
1646 delete[] nElem_Send;
1647 delete[] nElem_Flag;
1648}
1649
1650void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry, unsigned short Elem_Type) {
1651 unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
1652
1653 unsigned long iProcessor, NELEM = 0;
1654 unsigned long iElem, iNode, jNode, nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index;
1655
1656 unsigned long* Conn_Linear = nullptr;
1657 unsigned long* Conn_Elem = nullptr;
1658 unsigned long* Linear_Markers = nullptr;
1659 unsigned long* ID_SurfElem_Linear = nullptr;
1660 unsigned long* Local_Markers = nullptr;
1661 unsigned long* ID_SurfElem = nullptr;
1662
1663 SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr, *markerSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
1664 SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr, *markerRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
1665 int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1666
1667 /*--- Store the local number of this element type and the number of nodes
1668 per this element type. In serial, this will be the total number of this
1669 element type in the entire mesh. In parallel, it is the number on only
1670 the current partition. ---*/
1671
1672 switch (Elem_Type) {
1673 case LINE:
1674 NELEM = nLinear_Line;
1675 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_LINE;
1676 Conn_Linear = Conn_Line_Linear;
1677 Linear_Markers = ID_Line_Linear;
1678 ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_Line_Linear;
1679 break;
1680 case TRIANGLE:
1681 NELEM = nLinear_BoundTria;
1682 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
1683 Conn_Linear = Conn_BoundTria_Linear;
1684 Linear_Markers = ID_BoundTria_Linear;
1685 ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear;
1686 break;
1687 case QUADRILATERAL:
1688 NELEM = nLinear_BoundQuad;
1689 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
1690 Conn_Linear = Conn_BoundQuad_Linear;
1691 Linear_Markers = ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
1692 ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
1693 break;
1694 default:
1695 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1696 break;
1697 }
1698
1699 /*--- We start with the connectivity distributed across all procs in a
1700 linear partitioning. We need to loop through our local partition
1701 and decide how many elements we must send to each other rank in order to
1702 have all elements distributed according to the ParMETIS coloring. ---*/
1703
1704 int* nElem_Send = new int[size + 1];
1705 nElem_Send[0] = 0;
1706 int* nElem_Recv = new int[size + 1];
1707 nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
1708 int* nElem_Flag = new int[size];
1709
1710 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1711 nElem_Send[iProc] = 0;
1712 nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0;
1713 nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1714 }
1715 nElem_Send[size] = 0;
1716 nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
1717
1718 for (iElem = 0; iElem < NELEM; iElem++) {
1719 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1720 /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1721
1722 Global_Index = Conn_Linear[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
1723
1724 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1725
1726 iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
1727
1728 /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
1729 number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1730
1731 if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1732 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1733 nElem_Send[iProcessor + 1]++;
1734 }
1735 }
1736 }
1737
1738 /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
1739 all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1740 many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1741
1742 SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT, &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1743
1744 /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
1745 messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1746 the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1747 communications simpler. ---*/
1748
1749 int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1750 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1751
1752 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1753 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc + 1] > 0)) nSends++;
1754 if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1755
1756 nElem_Send[iProc + 1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
1757 nElem_Recv[iProc + 1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
1758 }
1759
1760 /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity that we are
1761 sending. ---*/
1762
1763 unsigned long* connSend = nullptr;
1764 connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]];
1765 for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) connSend[iSend] = 0;
1766
1767 /*--- Allocate arrays for storing the marker global index. ---*/
1768
1769 auto* markerSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1770 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) markerSend[iSend] = 0;
1771
1772 auto* idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1773 for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
1774
1775 /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
1776 position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1777
1778 auto* index = new unsigned long[size];
1779 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[iProc];
1780
1781 auto* markerIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1782 for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) markerIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
1783
1784 /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
1785 additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
1786
1787 for (iElem = 0; iElem < NELEM; iElem++) {
1788 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1789 /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1790
1791 Global_Index = Conn_Linear[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
1792
1793 /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1794
1795 iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
1796
1797 /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, load up the data
1798 for sending. ---*/
1799
1800 if (nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem) {
1801 nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1802 unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1803 unsigned long mm = markerIndex[iProcessor];
1804
1805 /*--- Load the connectivity values. ---*/
1806
1807 for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
1808 /*--- Note that elements are already stored directly based on
1809 their global index for the nodes. ---*/
1810
1811 connSend[nn] = Conn_Linear[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + jNode];
1812 nn++;
1813 }
1814
1815 /*--- Global marker ID for this element. ---*/
1816
1817 markerSend[mm] = Linear_Markers[iElem];
1818 idSend[mm] = ID_SurfElem_Linear[iElem];
1819
1820 /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1821
1822 index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
1823 markerIndex[iProcessor]++;
1824 }
1825 }
1826 }
1827
1828 /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1829
1830 delete[] index;
1831 delete[] markerIndex;
1832
1833 /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
1834 values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1835 we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1836 directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1837
1838 unsigned long* connRecv = nullptr;
1839 connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
1840 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1841
1842 auto* markerRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1843 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) markerRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1844
1845 auto* idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1846 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1847
1848 /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1849
1850 if (nSends > 0) {
1851 connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1852 markerSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1853 idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1854 }
1855 if (nRecvs > 0) {
1856 connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1857 markerRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1858 idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1859 }
1860
1861 /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1862
1863 InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq, connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq, NODES_PER_ELEMENT,
1864 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1865
1866 InitiateCommsAll(markerSend, nElem_Send, markerSendReq, markerRecv, nElem_Recv, markerRecvReq, 1,
1867 COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1868
1869 InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq, idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq, 1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1870
1871 /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1872
1873 iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[rank];
1874 myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank];
1875 myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Send[rank + 1];
1876 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1877 connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
1878 iRecv++;
1879 }
1880
1881 iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
1882 myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
1883 myFinal = nElem_Send[rank + 1];
1884 for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1885 markerRecv[iRecv] = markerSend[iSend];
1886 idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1887 iRecv++;
1888 }
1889
1890 /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1891
1892 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
1893 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, markerSendReq, nRecvs, markerRecvReq);
1894 CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1895
1896 /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper data
1897 structure. It will be loaded into the geometry objects in a later step. ---*/
1898
1899 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1900 Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT * nElem_Recv[size]];
1901 int count = 0;
1902 nElem_Total = 0;
1903 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1904 nElem_Total++;
1905 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1906 Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
1907 count++;
1908 }
1909 }
1910 }
1911
1912 /*--- Store the global marker IDs too. ---*/
1913
1914 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1915 Local_Markers = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1916 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1917 Local_Markers[iRecv] = markerRecv[iRecv];
1918 }
1919 }
1920
1921 /*--- Store the global surface elem IDs too. ---*/
1922
1923 if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1924 ID_SurfElem = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1925 for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1926 ID_SurfElem[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1927 }
1928 }
1929
1930 /*--- Store the particular global element count in the class data,
1931 and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
1932
1933 switch (Elem_Type) {
1934 case LINE:
1935 nLocal_Line = nElem_Total;
1936 if (nLocal_Line > 0) {
1937 Conn_Line = Conn_Elem;
1938 ID_Line = Local_Markers;
1939 Elem_ID_Line = ID_SurfElem;
1940 }
1941 break;
1942 case TRIANGLE:
1943 nLocal_BoundTria = nElem_Total;
1944 if (nLocal_BoundTria > 0) {
1945 Conn_BoundTria = Conn_Elem;
1946 ID_BoundTria = Local_Markers;
1947 Elem_ID_BoundTria = ID_SurfElem;
1948 }
1949 break;
1950 case QUADRILATERAL:
1951 nLocal_BoundQuad = nElem_Total;
1952 if (nLocal_BoundQuad > 0) {
1953 Conn_BoundQuad = Conn_Elem;
1954 ID_BoundQuad = Local_Markers;
1955 Elem_ID_BoundQuad = ID_SurfElem;
1956 }
1957 break;
1958 default:
1959 SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1960 break;
1961 }
1962
1963 /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1964
1965 delete[] connSendReq;
1966 delete[] markerSendReq;
1967 delete[] idSendReq;
1968
1969 delete[] connRecvReq;
1970 delete[] markerRecvReq;
1971 delete[] idRecvReq;
1972
1973 delete[] connSend;
1974 delete[] connRecv;
1975 delete[] markerSend;
1976 delete[] markerRecv;
1977 delete[] idSend;
1978 delete[] idRecv;
1979 delete[] nElem_Recv;
1980 delete[] nElem_Send;
1981 delete[] nElem_Flag;
1982}
1983
1984void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeMarkerTags(CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry) {
1985 unsigned long iMarker, index, iChar;
1986
1987 char str_buf[MAX_STRING_SIZE];
1988
1989 /*--- The master node will communicate the entire list of marker tags
1990 (in global ordering) so that it will be simple for each rank to grab
1991 the string name for each marker. ---*/
1992
1993 nMarker_Global = 0;
1994 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) nMarker_Global = config->GetnMarker_All();
1995
1996 /*--- Broadcast the global number of markers in the mesh. ---*/
1997
1998 SU2_MPI::Bcast(&nMarker_Global, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1999
2000 char* mpi_str_buf = new char[nMarker_Global * MAX_STRING_SIZE]();
2001 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2002 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker_Global; iMarker++) {
2003 SPRINTF(&mpi_str_buf[iMarker * MAX_STRING_SIZE], "%s", config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker).c_str());
2004 }
2005 }
2006
2007 /*--- Broadcast the string names of the variables. ---*/
2008
2009 SU2_MPI::Bcast(mpi_str_buf, (int)nMarker_Global * MAX_STRING_SIZE, MPI_CHAR, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2010
2011 /*--- Now parse the string names and load into our marker tag vector.
2012 We also need to set the values of all markers into the config. ---*/
2013
2014 for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker_Global; iMarker++) {
2015 index = iMarker * MAX_STRING_SIZE;
2016 for (iChar = 0; iChar < MAX_STRING_SIZE; iChar++) {
2017 str_buf[iChar] = mpi_str_buf[index + iChar];
2018 }
2019 Marker_Tags.emplace_back(str_buf);
2020 config->SetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker, str_buf);
2021 config->SetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker, NO);
2022 }
2023
2024 /*--- Free string buffer memory. ---*/
2025
2026 delete[] mpi_str_buf;
2027}
2028
2029void CPhysicalGeometry::LoadPoints(CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry) {
2030 unsigned long iPoint, jPoint, iOwned, iPeriodic, iGhost;
2031
2032 /*--- Create the basic point structures before storing the points. ---*/
2033
2034 nPoint = nLocal_Point;
2035 nPointDomain = nLocal_PointDomain;
2036
2037 nodes = new CPoint(nPoint, nDim, MESH_0, config);
2038
2039 Local_to_Global_Point = new long[nPoint];
2040
2041 /*--- Array initialization ---*/
2042
2043 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
2044 Local_to_Global_Point[iPoint] = -1;
2045 }
2046
2047 /*--- Set our counters correctly based on the number of owned and ghost
2048 nodes that we counted during the partitioning. ---*/
2049
2050 jPoint = 0;
2051 iOwned = 0;
2052 iPeriodic = nLocal_PointDomain;
2053 iGhost = nLocal_PointDomain + nLocal_PointPeriodic;
2054
2055 /*--- Loop over all of the points that we have recv'd and store the
2056 coordinates, global index, and colors ---*/
2057
2058 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
2059 /*--- Set the starting point to the correct counter for this point. ---*/
2060
2061 if (Local_Colors[iPoint] == (unsigned long)rank) {
2062 if (Local_Points[iPoint] < geometry->GetGlobal_nPointDomain())
2063 jPoint = iOwned;
2064 else
2065 jPoint = iPeriodic;
2066 } else {
2067 jPoint = iGhost;
2068 }
2069
2070 /*--- Get the global index ---*/
2071
2072 Local_to_Global_Point[jPoint] = Local_Points[iPoint];
2073
2074 /*--- Allocating the Point object ---*/
2075
2076 nodes->SetCoord(jPoint, &Local_Coords[iPoint * nDim]);
2077 nodes->SetGlobalIndex(jPoint, Local_to_Global_Point[jPoint]);
2078
2079 /*--- Set the color ---*/
2080
2081 nodes->SetColor(jPoint, Local_Colors[iPoint]);
2082
2083 /*--- Increment the correct counter before moving to the next point. ---*/
2084
2085 if (Local_Colors[iPoint] == (unsigned long)rank) {
2086 if (Local_Points[iPoint] < geometry->GetGlobal_nPointDomain())
2087 iOwned++;
2088 else
2089 iPeriodic++;
2090 } else {
2091 iGhost++;
2092 }
2093 }
2094
2095 /*--- Create the global to local mapping, which will be useful for loading
2096 the elements and boundaries in subsequent steps. ---*/
2097
2098 for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) Global_to_Local_Point[Local_to_Global_Point[iPoint]] = iPoint;
2099
2100 /*--- Set the value of Global_nPoint and Global_nPointDomain ---*/
2101
2102 unsigned long Local_nPoint = nPoint;
2103 unsigned long Local_nPointDomain = nPointDomain;
2104
2105#ifdef HAVE_MPI
2106 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&Local_nPoint, &Global_nPoint, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2107 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&Local_nPointDomain, &Global_nPointDomain, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2108#else
2109 Global_nPoint = Local_nPoint;
2110 Global_nPointDomain = Local_nPointDomain;
2111#endif
2112
2113 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size > SINGLE_NODE))
2114 cout << Global_nPoint << " vertices including ghost points. " << endl;
2115}
2116
2117void CPhysicalGeometry::LoadVolumeElements(CConfig* config, CGeometry* geometry) {
2118 unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
2119
2120 unsigned long iElem, jElem, kElem, iNode, Local_Elem, iGlobal_Index;
2121 unsigned long Local_Nodes[N_POINTS_HEXAHEDRON];
2122
2123 unsigned long iElemTria = 0;
2124 unsigned long iElemQuad = 0;
2125 unsigned long iElemTetr = 0;
2126 unsigned long iElemHexa = 0;
2127 unsigned long iElemPris = 0;
2128 unsigned long iElemPyra = 0;
2129
2130 unsigned long nTria, nQuad, nTetr, nHexa, nPris, nPyra;
2131
2132 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Tria_List;
2133 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Quad_List;
2134 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Tetr_List;
2135 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Hexa_List;
2136 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Pris_List;
2137 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Pyra_List;
2138 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator it;
2139
2140 /*--- It is possible that we have repeated elements during the previous
2141 communications, as we mostly focus on the grid points and their colors.
2142 First, loop through our local elements and build a mapping by simply
2143 overwriting the duplicate entries. ---*/
2144
2145 jElem = 0;
2146 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Tria; iElem++) {
2147 Tria_List[ID_Tria[iElem]] = iElem;
2148 }
2149 nTria = Tria_List.size();
2150
2151 jElem = 0;
2152 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Quad; iElem++) {
2153 Quad_List[ID_Quad[iElem]] = iElem;
2154 }
2155 nQuad = Quad_List.size();
2156
2157 jElem = 0;
2158 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Tetr; iElem++) {
2159 Tetr_List[ID_Tetr[iElem]] = iElem;
2160 }
2161 nTetr = Tetr_List.size();
2162
2163 jElem = 0;
2164 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Hexa; iElem++) {
2165 Hexa_List[ID_Hexa[iElem]] = iElem;
2166 }
2167 nHexa = Hexa_List.size();
2168
2169 jElem = 0;
2170 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Pris; iElem++) {
2171 Pris_List[ID_Pris[iElem]] = iElem;
2172 }
2173 nPris = Pris_List.size();
2174
2175 jElem = 0;
2176 for (iElem = 0; iElem < nLocal_Pyra; iElem++) {
2177 Pyra_List[ID_Pyra[iElem]] = iElem;
2178 }
2179 nPyra = Pyra_List.size();
2180
2181 /*--- Reduce the final count of non-repeated elements on this rank. ---*/
2182
2183 Local_Elem = nTria + nQuad + nTetr + nHexa + nPris + nPyra;
2184
2185 /*--- Create the basic structures for holding the grid elements. ---*/
2186
2187 jElem = 0;
2188 nElem = Local_Elem;
2189 elem = new CPrimalGrid*[nElem]();
2190
2191 /*--- Store the elements of each type in the proper containers. ---*/
2192
2193 for (it = Tria_List.begin(); it != Tria_List.end(); it++) {
2194 kElem = it->first;
2195 iElem = it->second;
2196
2197 /*--- Transform the stored connectivity for this element from global
2198 to local values on this rank. ---*/
2199
2200 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
2201 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
2202 iGlobal_Index = Conn_Tria[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
2203 Local_Nodes[iNode] = Global_to_Local_Point[iGlobal_Index];
2204 }
2205
2206 /*--- Create the element object. ---*/
2207
2208 elem[jElem] = new CTriangle(Local_Nodes[0], Local_Nodes[1], Local_Nodes[2]);
2209
2210 elem[jElem]->SetGlobalIndex(kElem);
2211
2212 /*--- Increment our local counters. ---*/
2213
2214 jElem++;
2215 iElemTria++;
2216 }
2217
2218 /*--- Free memory as we go. ---*/
2219
2220 Tria_List.clear();
2221
2222 for (it = Quad_List.begin(); it != Quad_List.end(); it++) {
2223 kElem = it->first;
2224 iElem = it->second;
2225
2226 /*--- Transform the stored connectivity for this element from global
2227 to local values on this rank. ---*/
2228
2229 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
2230 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
2231 iGlobal_Index = Conn_Quad[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
2232 Local_Nodes[iNode] = Global_to_Local_Point[iGlobal_Index];
2233 }
2234
2235 /*--- Create the element object. ---*/
2236
2237 elem[jElem] = new CQuadrilateral(Local_Nodes[0], Local_Nodes[1], Local_Nodes[2], Local_Nodes[3]);
2238
2239 elem[jElem]->SetGlobalIndex(kElem);
2240
2241 /*--- Increment our local counters. ---*/
2242
2243 jElem++;
2244 iElemQuad++;
2245 }
2246
2247 /*--- Free memory as we go. ---*/
2248
2249 Quad_List.clear();
2250
2251 for (it = Tetr_List.begin(); it != Tetr_List.end(); it++) {
2252 kElem = it->first;
2253 iElem = it->second;
2254
2255 /*--- Transform the stored connectivity for this element from global
2256 to local values on this rank. ---*/
2257
2258 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TETRAHEDRON;
2259 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
2260 iGlobal_Index = Conn_Tetr[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
2261 Local_Nodes[iNode] = Global_to_Local_Point[iGlobal_Index];
2262 }
2263
2264 /*--- Create the element object. ---*/
2265
2266 elem[jElem] = new CTetrahedron(Local_Nodes[0], Local_Nodes[1], Local_Nodes[2], Local_Nodes[3]);
2267
2268 elem[jElem]->SetGlobalIndex(kElem);
2269
2270 /*--- Increment our local counters. ---*/
2271
2272 jElem++;
2273 iElemTetr++;
2274 }
2275
2276 /*--- Free memory as we go. ---*/
2277
2278 Tetr_List.clear();
2279
2280 for (it = Hexa_List.begin(); it != Hexa_List.end(); it++) {
2281 kElem = it->first;
2282 iElem = it->second;
2283
2284 /*--- Transform the stored connectivity for this element from global
2285 to local values on this rank. ---*/
2286
2287 NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_HEXAHEDRON;
2288 for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
2289 iGlobal_Index = Conn_Hexa[iElem * NODES_PER_ELEMENT + iNode];
2290 Local_Nodes[iNode] = Global_to_Local_Point[iGlobal_Index];
2291 }
2292
2293 /*--- Create the element object. ---*/
2294
2295 elem[jElem] = new CHexahedron(Local_Nodes[0], Local_Nodes[1], Local_Nodes[2], Local_Nodes[3], Local_Nodes[4],
2296 Local_Nodes[5], Local_Nodes[6], Local_Nodes[7]);
2297
2298 elem[jElem]->SetGlobalIndex(kElem);
2299
2300 /*--- Increment our local counters. ---*/
2301
2302 jElem++;
2303 iElemHexa++;
2304 }
2305
